Reviews.Title: “Nice clean, close to town”
Reviews.Author: Alisa C
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was excellent, staff was friendly, hotel was very clean and well kept. We didn't use the pool because it was in March, but it was in a cute little courtyard. Hotel offers a workout room, pool, free breakfast which has anything you could want. The concierge on duty when we checked in gave us a map and actually drew our route to get to downtown and told us about things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “With friendly staff, this hotel is very economical, clean, and close to the port.”
Reviews.Author: ShawFam1
Reviews.Content: FYI- I chose this hotel as a result of reading many positive reviews! My party of 12 stayed here en route to a cruise. We were very pleased with the friendliness of the staff. As the coordinator, I spoke with them regularly and was always happy with their tone and willingness to accommodate. The complex was clean and inviting. I would DEFINITELY stay again and recommend to family/friends. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “the big easy”
Reviews.Author: doreen j
Reviews.Content: this is my second time in this motel. the front desk was very helpful and efficient. the security is awesome. i left my car running, they pooned my room number and staye there until i could turn off the car. the breakffast is much better than last year. they moved it to another room and its much bigger and better. i would definetly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Toyin B
Reviews.Content: VERY friendly and nice front desk employee-Tira. Met all needs as requested. Was able to answer any tourist questions and call awesome transportation service. A little more to the continental breakfast would have been awesome- eggs and fruit. In order to enjoy your stay due to the area, car rental is highly recommended. What was saved in hotel accommodation was spent on transportation. The area looks a little rough but Super 8 is safe and secure. HIGHLY recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Super 8”
Reviews.Author: Nichole T
Reviews.Content: The breakfast bar could include fruit like apples and bananas. It was all good but fruit would have made my day. Cathy the housekeeper was very polite and friendly I enjoyed talking to her while she cleaned our room. She made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good price & very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Super 8 for 2 nights. Although it was not the best of an area, we saw a security guard walk around each night which made us feel safe. Jackie Nguyen was at the front desk when we arrived and helped us tremendously. She pulled out a map of New Orleans and highlighted the exit we should take, parking lots and their prices, as well as good places to eat at. Breakfast was good. They had the make your own waffle maker, which is what I made each morning. A staff member was also there restocking the breakfast items and cleaning up.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and basic.”
Reviews.Author: Gregory F
Reviews.Content: This Super 8 was very adequate. The rooms seemed clean and the beds were very good. The staff was very accomodating and Cathy Smith kept our room clean and well supplied and was very helpful. The neighborhood is not the best, but thier security was up to the task. Bus stop across the street provided a good transportation alternative. The next door building is ready for demolition and redevelopment.

Reviews.Title: “you're getting what you payed for”
Reviews.Author: Jenn M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good. Could have done with a renovation, but clean. The neighborhood was bad, but they have a guy stay outside all night long to watch your car. I felt safe despite the neighborhood. Really close to the french quarter, maybe 20 mins. The people staying there were kind of loud at one point, but the staff would have done something had I mentioned it. I was to tired to care. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their computer in the business room needed fixing, but other than that, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “great service from housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: harvey w
Reviews.Content: The facility was an older establishment however it was very clean. I was very impressed with a housekeeper Cathy Smith. She was more than I had expected. Very helpful , friendly and had exceptional guest relations. She was by far the highlight of my stay at Super 8. She is a definite asset to your company and deserves what ever compensation or upward mobility that is available. Overall all my contact with the staff was positive because they were very friendly and helpful. However Cathy was the high point of my families expererience with Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: fieldsold
Reviews.Content: I picked up one of the travel discount booklets that one finds in restaurants along I-10, and this place had a coupon and directions that didn't sound too hard. It is located about 4 miles from downtown NOLA, and is only a few blocks from an I-10 exit. The motel itself is charming from the front, as it has wrought iron railings to give the place a French Quarter vibe. You park under the rooms (no rooms on ground floor), and in addition to parking you find gardens and a small pool on the ground floor. The woman at the front desk when I arrived and the guy there when I checked out after two days were extremely friendly and welcoming. They made me feel good. Now for the not as good. My room looked as if it hadn't been remodeled since 1975. Very retro, but not in a cool way. But on the other hand, it seemed clean, the a/c worked fine, and I loved the mattress. The tv was ok. But if you don't need good decor, then it is fine. The area around this motel is pretty scary looking. The multi-story building right next to the motel has been abanded for some reason, and has broken windows, etc. But the motel is surrounded by a tall fence with barbed wire at the top, and there are multiple guards roaming the grounds at night, so I (a woman traveling alone) felt perfectly safe there. Also, the motel is gated, and the gates on one side are locked at night--I suppose so that the guards don't have to watch both sets of gates at night. I didn't try the free breakfast, so can't speak to that. I'd have no problem staying at this motel again. I paid $54 per night with my discount coupon. I did see that there is a Motel 6 just a few blocks down the road that charges $45 or so, and I might also want to check it out, as it is even cheaper and maybe in a slightly better location (near a McDonald's and some other restaurants). But I have no complaints about this Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking & Continental Buffet”
Reviews.Author: GASnow
Reviews.Content: For a moderate price you will not find a better deal in New Orleans. they let us park our car free in their fenced in lot with surveillance cameras, while we went on cruise. They offered a buffet breakfast that was far better than most other chains of the "cut-rate" budget motels. A definite diamond in the rough by my standards. Also had a computer for guests to use to check e-mails and upload pictures onto jump drive at no extra cost. When you are traveling on a budget it's the small things like this that mean the most! Convience store next to motel for beer, razors, toothpaste, shampoo, or anything else you may have forgotten to pack. My Dad needed a razor to shave.

Reviews.Title: “QuÃ© buen servicio! Perfect service, help and security”
Reviews.Author: limatil
Reviews.Content: I must explain this history in order that you know what kind of hotel you are going to stay. 2011- Mardi Grass. During the week of the 9th March, we stayed at this hotel for a few days. When we checked out, we drove direction Baton Rouge. As we arrived, we found out that my husband had lost his back bag with all documents, passport, computer, etc. somewhere... The recepcionist in Super 8 La Place helped us a lot. We were very nervous, and she even let us phone to New Orleans just to check if our bag was there. No news, but finally, we decided to drove back to New Orleans. As we arrived the recepcionist, Nimahs, helped us a lot! Security guy, Dal, also. But as they didnÂ´t know about the lost bag, we asked to check the security cameras. The responsible guy came, and checked the cameras with my husband. Thanks to that, the bag was found! Happy end of the history thanks to that people! No one accepted any tips from us. We surely will recomend Super 8 hotels from now on. On the other hand, I must say that this is not a well located hotel if you want to party every night in the French Quarter. But we thought it was a good choice, also thinking about prices, and because we had our own car.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Kristian
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all TA's, for helping me find this little gem. 5 mins from downtown in car, some of the friendliest staff i've meet in my 3 visits to the states. Room was nice, breakfast was plenty, didn't use the pool but i saw it and it looked fine for childrens use, and again, the staff was so helpful. Well stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with cheap rate.”
Reviews.Author: Duke_of_MTL
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks old in a charming way. Pool is very small but clean. Complimentary breakfast includes DIY waffle, bagels, brioches, cereals, coffee, tea etc... Breakfast room is clean and well supplied. Room is well kept and bed is comfortable. Covered parking is a plus especially when there is a big storm outside. This hotel is about 5 miles from French Quarter and all the actions. I felt safe inside the hotel but i hate the cigarette smoke in the corridor leading to my room. Sorry to all smokers :-) Check-in and check-out are quick and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Two Week Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and good housekeeping staff, especially Cathy. Breakfast area was very clean and breakfast items were kept supplied. Very helpful front desk staff and manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KT121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, we were greeted with great service, the hotel was quiet, rooms were clean, and although it might not be located in the most luxurious area, it was easy to get to and a short trip from everything else. Staff was great about answering questions, and helping us get around town. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOLA Charm”
Reviews.Author: Tara F
Reviews.Content: It was a tad confusing figuring out how to get into the parking lot as we came off 10 Westbound but once we made a U-turn and pulled up I was very impressed with the wright iron railings and courtyards. There was a pool and covered parking, which was very nice since it had just rained. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom way tiny because the sink was outside the door. I had a hard time figuring out the shower but my brother was able to get it working. The hotel is located right next to 10 but I barely heard any traffic while we were in the room itself. We were also able to get down to the French Quarter in 15 minutes with a map the front desk gave us with some tips on where to park. When we came back one of the gates was locked so that people coming in had to go by the front desk, I liked this added bit of security and felt our car behind the fence was safe (my brother was moving so it was fully packed).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Santa Tecla, La Libertad, El Salvador
Reviews.Title: “Weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sandra F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at a good price compared with any other hotels downtown. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. there is an adequate breakfast included. There is also a pool which my husband used - it is small but clean, and other families were also using it. this is not a motel to spend time at, but a very comfortable one to come back to after a busy day. We were glad we had the car to get in to town quickly - you can catch buses but these are not too frequent, and there are no restaurants closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: johnny g
Reviews.Content: We,Johnny and Paulett Granger, thank Tira and Ms. Cathy for going an extra mile to please us and make us comfortable. Ms. Jackie was also kind and courteous checking us out. We discovered the motel to be SAFE and very clean. We would recommend this motel to anyone. We wish the best to everyone. Location is convenient and easy to down town. With Kind Reards, We Remain Very Truly Yours, Johnny and Paulett Granger

Reviews.Title: “Best super 8 we stayed at on our trip”
Reviews.Author: Thenderson555
Reviews.Content: Stayed there before and after our carnival cries out of new Orleans. The motel is definitely old, but the staff are very polite and work hard to keep this hotel clean and safe. Security guard keeps close watch on the premises. Our room's air conditioner was not cooling and they let us move to another room after checking it.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jaime P
Reviews.Content: Super 8 at New Orleans the best room are at the front of the hotel. I can believe they have nice clean rooms and serving breakfast. I like this small hotel because everything is close to it and freeway access to anywhere. going to the French Quarter take 10 minutes and you can drive to Cajun encounters less than 20 minutes taking highway 90 that is Chef Menteur. my stay at the hotel was great friendly people and great service. Parking is ok but suggest to park close to the front they also have security at night. I will said they are the most clean place I see so far from New Orleans small Hotel and I give them A plus to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NWMAN16
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here for a convention. The drive to the New Orleans Convention Center from here was not bad at all and we were able to save a lot of money. This hotel is older, but the service makes the difference. The front desk staff is excellent. One lady took time to draw out on a map how to get to a particular location. The rooms were cleaned well each day and we felt confident that any issue we might have would be resolved. It is evident that the management placed a priority on customer service. We enjoyed our stay here very much. I would recommend this to others who are looking for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “House Keeping at Super 8: Cathy Smith”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Cathy Smith, did a great job of cleaning the room while my son and I stayed at Super 8 in New Orleans. She was also very courteous and professional. Employees like Ms. Smith make a hotel guest's stay a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but clean”
Reviews.Author: hawkesc
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, road trip for our family and wanted cheap but clean. And close to French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: gregory0903
Reviews.Content: We drove in and the neighborhood did not look welcoming so we were apprehensive about staying. We went in and got greeted very warmly and professionally by the front desk person, so based on that we asked to see the accommodations before registering. The room was on the 2nd floor right off the elevator and was clean. The furnishings we very basic but for the great rate we had our expectation was simply a clean quiet safe room and we got that PLUS great service from all of the staff there. They have a 24 hour guard on duty that patrols the premises like a hawk. Be not affraid! It's also right off of I10 and across the street from the metro bus that takes you to a street car that takes you into downtown New Orleans. We had a great, great 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Quarter charm”
Reviews.Author: Amy O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just off the highway with easy access to the downtown area. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They genuinely care about their guests. I arrived at the hotel around 1pm, well before check-in but the hotel was very accomodating and allowed me to check in early. When I was searching for my room I encountered a housekeeper who not only directed me to my room but then went out of her way to open the door for me, seeing that I had my hands full. When I walked in the bed was not made. I asked the housekeeper about it and she said she would go find someone who would help her make the bed but also suggested I call the front desk. I called the front desk and she was very apologetic and said she could move me to another room but I happened to really like my room so I suggested if they could just make my bed I would be satisfied. The housekeeper came back with another employee to make the bed and before they could finish 2 members of management were in my room ensuring that everything else was inspected and as it should be. They apologized for the inconvenience several times and assured me this was not a common place occurance. About an hour later there was a knock at my door and the front desk attendant handed me a gift bag and thanked me for staying at their hotel and again apologized for the problem. The following day I did have an issue with the drain pull on the sink sticking, but I called the front desk and they sent someone up who fixed it promptly. Someone mentioned in another review that this was not a safe area which may or may not be true. However, most people who are coming to New Orleans and opt to stay outside of the downtown area are either coming to visit family or enjoying the attractions in the city, so I don't see why this would be an issue. The hotel itself, despite what may be around it, felt very safe. I am a single woman traveling alone and I never felt in danger. If you want a nice place to stay with a great courteous staff this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: EMZR84
Reviews.Content: We called to reserve a room and asked if it was pet friendly since we were traveling with our dog, they said yes, of course when we got there it was not! The location was scary, bad area I did not feel safe with my 2 kids. It got worse as we got to the room, bugs in the shower and I am sure i was bit by bed bugs in my sleep because I woke up with a rash and itching all over!!! I will not recomend this place ever!!! When we spoke to the front desk the next morning as we checked out they said it was the first time they had heard about bugs in the room, which is surpricing since reading some reviews, I am not the first to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: Bryan, the desk clerk, was very helpful. He explained how the bus to downtown stopped right across the street, thus saving us hefty parking fees in the French Quarters. Hotel has lovely, private pool. Cathy, the maid, was generous with lots of fresh towels. Continental breakfast held in a lovely dining room. All in all a good experience at very modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Less than we bargained for”
Reviews.Author: sjrosado
Reviews.Content: The room was suppsoed to be non-smoking but has a stale odor of smoke. I suppose it could be because all the rooms around us were smoking rooms and ours was not designated non-smoking on the door like the others located in the main corridor of hotel. Furniture and furnishings were also riddles with cigarette burns. I brought it to the attention of mgmt but they wrote me off. There was a power outage that lasted well over 12 hours and the only thing staff would say was that we were welcome to check out and go somewhere else. The pictures are old and misleading as well. this is a very rough area of town and I dont suggest this location with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, well run.”
Reviews.Author: colo1
Reviews.Content: Clean, conveniently located and manned by a friendly, helpful staff. The design is actually kind of charming, too -- a three story courtyard-based layout with lots of New Orleans-style wrought iron. The 94 bus stops right at the motel and can connect you to everything if you're note driving. I'll be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: funinsunMinnesota
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! Very close to French Quarter. It was very handy having our own car because we were told that a taxi would cost about $20. And we found parking downtown for $5. The girl that checked us in, Angela, was super friendly. She told us how to get to certain places and told us about places we should avoid. Rooms were very spacious and clean. The only thing that I can say is that I wish there had been fresh fruit in the breakfast selections. I would much rather stay here than right downtown...much cheaper along with free parking. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Super 8 New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sandra D
Reviews.Content: First time staying@Super8 and I was impressed.Rooms were very clean, good size with plenty of amenities. Can't beat price! I decided to stay here because I had read reviews and they had good rates. This charming motel offers free parking and continental breakfast, another plus! Staff was nice and friendly. Stayed 1 night and took a cruise the following day. Place is right next to highway and took us about 10 minutes to get to ship pier. I would definitely recommend and will stay here again on my next cruise which will hopefully be soon.

Reviews.Title: “super8 motel new orleans la”
Reviews.Author: donhunter96
Reviews.Content: Most courteous and helpful staff that i have ever been associated with. This includes the front desk people, maids, and security people. Rooms were clean, breakfast was good, will stay here again when I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Darkneg777
Reviews.Content: Once again super 8 has not let me down, I got my room for $65 tax and all as a walk in, and got a 2 queen room. The bathroom was relatively mold free and the room was nice and clean. It's 5 miles from the french quarter, all highway driving.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more helpful - fab staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lol1980
Reviews.Content: Well, there are many for points for this hotel. The staff are absolutely fantastic. They couldn't do more to help us - they gave us advice on buses to catch, how to get around town, they called us cabs and couldn't have been more helpful. Tira (?) was fantastic to us, even calling to confirm a taxi for us so we didn't have to! Breakfast is ok. There is juice and tea or coffee to drink. Two choices of cereal, pastries as well as a waffle maker which made great waffles with maple syrup to put on them - it would have been nice if some fruit was on offer just so we could feel a little healthy! The room was large and we had two double beds which were very comfy with clean bedding (even mattress protectors) to give us a good nights sleep. You could tell it was older accommodation as the noise when you flushed the toilet, shook the whole room. The walls are thin as we could hear people above and below us as well as people walking past our room. It was very busy at the time though as the basketball finals were on in new Orleans - which we weren't aware of at the time! There was free wifi in the room which was great for us! Location is the main drawback as it is far out. You couldn't walk into the city from the hotel. You could get a bus from opposite the hotel which costs $3 for A whole day pass - you will need to change onto a street car once you get to canal street. Taxis cost about $20 - there were two of us each way. The hotel have a shuttle driver who charges $10 per person to take you in. A great start to our road trip overall! Would go back but only if had own transport to get around with. Thank you to all of the staff who helped us out while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Professionally run and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: We read reviews of motels in New Orleans before choosing this one based on good feedback from others. It turned out to be a good choice, for it was a comfortable stay and the staff obviously put a lot of effort into making it a quality establishment. When we left they even had staff doing work in the garden. The room itself was good, with two beds, a fridge and coffee maker. Amazingly, the wifi also worked in the room, which I found to be something of a rarity for places in this price range. The floor sloped slightly downwards, which was a bit odd, but it didn't matter at all. There is plenty of parking, even if the spaces are quite tight. The motel is equipped with a gym, which I didn't use, plus an outdoor pool, which looked quite good but was far too cold when I was there. The business center was very useful, for I was able to print out flight tickets. Breakfast was good (though waffles would enhance it!), but was packed away promptly at 9:30. It was good to fill up in the morning while watching the news before going into New Orleans for the day. That brings me to the location - it's not in an area that you'd want to walk around, but isn't too far from fast food places and is very close to the interstate, so it's easy to get into New Orleans itself. A lot of the motels in New Orleans are in this area. This is an impressive motel and I would happily stay here again if I was every lucky enough to be able to return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “room was clean and service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chandra W
Reviews.Content: The housekeeper for my room, Cathy Smith, was excellent! Our room was very clean and in order. She was soooo sweet and communicated with us regarding our needs. She was just so friendly and personable and really seemed to care about the quality of our stay. Everyone was just so nice. One of the staff, perhaps a manager, gave us recommendations on where to find beignets outside of the French Quarter. He directed us to a place in Slidell, LA right off of I-10 on Old Spanish Trail just past the Super 8 there called Beignet au Lait.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Older Hotel With Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: From the ease of check in to the comfort of the room I knew I was in for a good stay. The front desk staff were attentive, friendly and accomodating. The room was spacious and comfortably furnished. The only drawback was some kind of construction work or something going on that required a shop vac to run constantly. There was a small table provided for work space. A desk or larger table would have been better. Check out was a breeze. The facility was conveniently located to all the major points of interest in the 'Big Easy'.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: vacationsareus
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, VERY CLEAN. The desk clerks were super, polite, helpful, friendly. The parking was great--FREE while we cruised. The van driver was very nice, friendly and we didn't have to navigate New Orleans traffic, Dropped us off right at the cruise terminal and picked us up right at the door, PERFECT. Would we stay here again, you bet!!

Reviews.Title: “Good- cheap place to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Genia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during mardi gras and saved a load of money! The staff were very nice and helpful! It is a bit out of the way-too far to walk to sights but bus fare is cheap. Take a cab back at night- $40-50 for a group of 4. Do not expect new conditions- this is a broken-in establishment but they keep it clean with a good staff! The morning breakfast is clean, freshly made and well stocked however mostly bread products- carbs. We will stay here again foir the price & chance to see New Orleans it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Larinda69
Reviews.Content: My name is Larinda Owusu and I wanted to say I enjoyed the cleanness of my room. The bathroom was sparkling clean, with fresh white towels. Cathy Smith was my housekeeping lady she provide excellent cleaning service,but at the same time she made me feel at home. Anything I need she was able to get and let me tell you this lady cleans as if she was cleaning her home. Thanks Cathy for all your service and generous hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Average hotel coupled with basic amenities. Good accommodations for a short stay in New Orleans. However, I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel if you do not have your own transportation; or if you would rely on public bus to get around New Orleans. TRAVEL DATES: April-2009 LOCATION: Situated across the bridge from downtown New Orleans; Easy access to I-10. The French Quarter is approximately 15 minutes away. Thereâ€™s plenty of restaurant on the same street, a couple of blocks from the hotel, primarily fast food restaurants. The area gets really crowded especially on weekends. Iâ€™d recommend getting your food to go and eat it in your room. Itâ€™s safer that way. POSITIVE NOTES: Good for a short stay in NOLA; Parking is somewhat secure. NEGATIVE NOTES: The surrounding area within a mile radius of the hotel is not too promising. A type of neighborhood where you donâ€™t want to have car trouble, or walk at night from the bus stop. The hotel and the surrounding neighborhood are frequented by party goers during weekends. We checked-in on a weekday and checked-out on a Sunday, and witnessed an influx of party goers. AMENITIES: Free Continental Breakfast, Free Wi-Fi, Micro/Fridge, Coffee Maker, Hairdryer; Swimming Pool NIGHTLY RATE: Low $70s after applicable taxes DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: None. I booked my accommodations online via Travelocity where I was able to secure it for a slightly lower price. HELPFUL TIP: I wouldnâ€™t recommend staying at this hotel if you are relying on getting around by public bus. The surrounding area of the hotel doesnâ€™t look safe walking around at night from the bus stop, especially if you have children. However, you should be fine if you are planning to travel by taxi, or better yet, if you have your own transportation. Do not get the room near the stairwell adjacent to the swimming pool area. People always congregate in that vicinity. They tend to be real noisy and annoying. Request for a room located on the opposite side of the wing. NOTES: Please click the green â€œYESâ€� button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Park here for free while cruising.”
Reviews.Author: skidocark
Reviews.Content: We chose this place soley because we could park our two cars free while on a cruise. The lot at the cruise terminal was $16/day so I saved a couple hundred dollars in parking by paying $60 a night for two rooms. The transfer from the hotel to the pier was arranged at the front desk for $7 per person. Rooms were clean and basic (had never stayed at a Super 8 before and was a little apprehensive). Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful as previous reviewers had said. It was fine for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Topperdan
Reviews.Content: Jan 2012. If you are cruising out of New Orleans, you can't beat this place. Under $75 for 2 people, clean rooms, comfortable bed, secure property, VERY friendly staff and you can park your car here for the cruise FREE!. (Cruise parking is $12 a day). They have arrangements for shuttle service to the pier ($20) or you can take a cab (about $25). Not that far away from the French Quarters or downtown. 10-15 min. The morning breakfast was the standard deal but they keep it fresh and stocked till 9AM. This is our second time here and we will go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good price. Although I wish for a little more.”
Reviews.Author: Demetrie O
Reviews.Content: The price for staying is good as long as you pay before the price rises due to the special events that are/will happen in New Orleans. Such as Carnival Season and others like the Sugar Bowl. The rooms are good expecially for the twin-bed rooms, although I wish the rooms had DVD players that comes with them just in-case if I ever wanted to watch a movie, but I guess you just have to bring you own. I like that they have a free continental breakfast even though I wish they have eggs along besides just waffles and sweet pasterees. Overall, this hotel is short of like a bang-for-a-buck.

Reviews.Title: “Good price on the rooms but cab fair will kill you!!”
Reviews.Author: Shuver
Reviews.Content: The location was not to bad. It was 16-30$ cab fair one way to get down to canal street. The bus does pick up across the street, but we were advised not to ride it at night. The room was a typical motel room, but the bathroom didn't work the first 2 days we were there!! We had to go to the lobby to use the restroom( a bit inconvenient) The staff was super nice and helpful!! I was a little surprised they didn't do more to compensate us for the bathroom issue.The rates were really good considering what all was going on in New Orleans this weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: We found last minute accommodations here for a big LSU event. Found the reviews to be favorable and the price hard to beat, so we booked a room. Surprised at how easy the hotel was to find- right off the expressway, which is not pretty, but very convenient. Given its surroundings, the hotel seemed nice enough with a balcony and New Orleans flair. Having arrived late, we were pleasantly greeted by the desk clerk who informed us of the free internet, workout room, continental breakfast, etc. The observant clerk even noticed where we had parked and told us we could stay there even though my husband had just commented to me privately that he thought we were going to have to move the car. Our room was spacious and clean. (I checked the mattresses-looked brand new) The seat was up on a newly cleaned and spotless toilet. The bedroom had a mirror in it which is great when trying to get dressed, and we could leave the ironing board out and still have room to get around. Although we did not use them, the frig and microwave looked nice as well. Upon checking out, we were greeted again by two very helpful employees. Cathy Smith happened to be reponsible for cleaning our room, and she obviously takes pride in her work because our room was spotless. And Tara, behind the counter, was equally professional and courteous. We appreciate the value since there was nothing more that a "four star" hotel could have offered, but for a lot more money. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: LozA13
Reviews.Content: Very basic place to stay with adjoining buildings still run down from Katrina. If you have a car and looking for good value this is perfect. Complimentary Breakfast is adequate for what you pay. Overall we saved money on staying in french quarter... Taxi was $20 one way and closer to $45 to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “All Good Except For One Unhelpful Person”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights in this hotel in New Orleans with my son in December. Whilst it's a little out of the centre of New Orleans (it's a $16 cab fare to the French Quarter), the position is just fine and easy to find. Parking is a breeze, with plenty of room. Service was mostly very friendly and helpful. When I checked in the lady on reception was uninterested and made me feel as welcome as leprosy, but the next day she was wonderful and helpful. The room was spot on - spacious, clean and comfortable. Free WIFI, free use of business centre computer, free breakfast, good security and more. It's was a nice stay, but on reflection I probably wouldn't stay again because of the unhelpful nature of the receptionist at check in. I'm over grumpy people.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough.....”
Reviews.Author: TLCMartin
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 24 going on a family/friends cruise. Let me first start by saying Kenneth is AWESOME. He is the Manager of the hotel and is so great to work with. I was in constant contact with him for almost a year...confirming, adding, changing names, etc. until the day we arrived. He was very professional, helpful and did everything to make our group stay more enjoyable. The hotel is a great place to stay if you are on a budget. It is nice, clean, and very accomodating. Each room total was $56.39 (tax included) and we were able to leave all of our vehicles in the secured covered parking around back at no additional charge while on our cruise. The hotel is within 10 minutes of the French Quarter, about 20 minutes from Harrah's Casino and about 30 minutes from the cruise terminal. The front desk staff was extremely helpful especially since our group checked in at different times thoughout the day and night. It's not near many restaurants or places that are within walking distance so we drove to most places. Although, many say the hotel is not located in the best of neighborhoods, I can honestly say it is definitely a diamond in the rough. 24 of us stayed here and we left 9 vehicles here for 7 nights while cruising and we would not hesitate to stay here again and again. Thank you Kenneth and Super 8 staff for making our pre-cruise stay wonderful! - Tamra Martin

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience and priced right.”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel on my recent Trip to New Orleans. One night Pre-cruise and one night post cruise. (two nights) The staff is friendly and helpful and fun to be around and to speak with. The rooms were clean and cool and very comfortable. I will stay here again when i return to New Orleans. The Nightly rates were very reasonable. They do have a continental breakfast which was good. My experience very pleasant. Thanks to the Management staff for making it that way, And by the way To the manager... My wife and I will like to try any recommendations on any great BBQ when we come through next time. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price..”
Reviews.Author: Mariaf361
Reviews.Content: My husband and i are very happy with our spacious, clean, comfortable room .. For the price you cant beat it... And its close to everything... We will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Charles1954
Reviews.Content: The entire staff were excellent. Everyone was courtious, outgoing, respectful and helpful in anyway possible from providing maps and the easiest routes to calling cabs and notifying us in the room when they arrived. The room was clean and well kept. Security was present to insure our safety and our car. I have already made reservations here again for a later trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Marcela I
Reviews.Content: We were a huge group devided in 4 rooms of 4/5 people each staying for 2 nights in March 2011. I wasn't expecting much but the room was ok. It was clean but it had cigarrette smell. It has a fridge, hair dryer, a table and it is quite big, not bad at all. What I didn't like was that the door and windows looked vulnerable. Staff: I didn't have much contact with the staff so I can't really say anything about them Is not a bad choise if you are with friends, have a car (hotel is far from the city) and want to save some money. For a group of girls I would stay somewhere else. If I had to comeback with friends, it wouldn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read”
Reviews.Author: LizDD
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one night stop before a cruise. It's not in the best neighborhood but we had no problems at all. Security is great, clean rooms and everything in the room worked ie blow dryer, coffee maker, etc. Beds were not the best but adequate for our purposes. Found out once we got there that they allow parking for the duration of the cruise and transportation to the port. Wish I had known this before paying $60 dollars to a garage near the port where we still had to be shuttled. The breakfast was continental but good, everything was fresh. Overall there is nothing bad I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly straff”
Reviews.Author: StefÃ¡n SigurÃ°ur G
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Very helpful staf, especially : TIRA she very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to the South”
Reviews.Author: Dishare
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very helpful and friendly, especially Kenneth and Cathy. Bedspread was old and ratty with burn holes all over even though it was non smoking room. Location was ok though no restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Destinlocal123
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor and read all the reviews. When your looking for an economic hotel, you assume certain things. This hotel was clean! I even use to manage hotels for ten years and the housekeeping staff is awesome. I saw doors retail open throughout the day, which indicates inspections are happening. And I did ask to see my room prior to checking in. I checked the room and it was good. So I stayed for two days. Great staff. Very friendly guy at the desk. Security was polite and helpful. It was only $16 for a cab ride to house of blues or anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Based On Tripadvisor Reviews, Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on a Thursday September 22, 2011 around 12n. There was an unexpected down pour and I was pleased with the friendliness of the manager on duty and he allowed me to check in early. Prior to checking in for my reservation, I wanted to see the actual room I'd be renting and this was not a problem. There was not a noise problem during my stay, and there were plenty of guest lodging at the same time based on the parking lot. There was security at night that was seen actually making rounds as I traveled in and out. The hotel lobby, elevator, hallways and interior rooms were clean and bug free (i had worried about a few bad reviews notating a bug problem, but this wasnt my experience). There was a walgreens pharmacy, grocery store, and plenty of fast food choices within a couple of minutes without having to get onto the interstate (even a 24 hour waffle house). There is an adult bookstore next door, but this did not bring any type of problem whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “BAD MOTEL STAY”
Reviews.Author: Dorris P
Reviews.Content: the bed were never cleaned, the same linens were on the bed. i would like a refund of $265.36. the office people who checked you in were not the friendly people either. they did not tell me just what time check-out was so i got charged for another day. it was so that i needed to get back on the road off the rain. when we went into the room the night of september 01,2011 it had not been clean because their was no toilet paper nor soap in it.every day i had to ask for towels and thing to use to get cleaned up. please send me a refund of the money that i spend for 4 nights of not been serviced at this motel. doris myers room 253

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Amanda R
Reviews.Content: The motel may not have had all the latest fittings but it was always clean and well presented. Our room was cleaned everyday by some wonderful people (particularly Miss Cathy!!). Wifi was awesome. I really just needed a safe place to sleep at night and this motel delivered more than that. Would definitely recommend a stay here. Taxi fare to French Quarter from here is about $20.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but clean and dependable”
Reviews.Author: Imagine87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group doing a Habitat for Humanity project for a week and although it's not in a great part of town, I found this hotel to be just fine. It doesn't have many frills, but the rooms are clean and they do serve a continental breakfast (cereal, toast, juice, oatmeal) every morning which is nice. The staff are helpful and in the rooms, I could not hear any outside noise even though it is located right off the highway. It's only a 10-12 minute drive to the French Quarter which was convenient as well. I think it would be hard to beat the price that we paid so if you're looking for a budget hotel that is dependable, I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: crene4115
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, the prices was reasonable but it was expensive for this hotel. It was a bunch of kids there for something and we were placed in the middle of them without anyone telling us, we were unable to get sleep, the hotel it self smell like mildew, didnt look clean, the and continental breakfast consist of bread, cereal and milk and Bryan on the night shift was very rude when we checked out. On the outside there are prostitutes and spiders everywhere. No amount of money would I spend again at this hotel, no matter what your budget is, it is not up to the amount.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches and prostitutes”
Reviews.Author: luv4lesss
Reviews.Content: I booked this too based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We were in NOLA for a track meet. I had booked at the airport days inn but they were more expensive and the reviews were horrific. When we check in the room was small but worked ok for us, we drove in from California so we were tired. When we finally got relaxed my oldest daughter said, she saw a roach go into the drawer. I checked and did not see one. When my other daughter got up in the morning to get dressed she opened her drawer and there it was. I killed it and took the dead roach to the front desk. I was told they fumigate monthly and she was very sorry. She upgraded me to another room which was much nicer. On our last night there, we saw another. By this point we were done with this place. I took a picture and gave it to the front desk upon check out. We were given a discount for the 2 out of 4 nights because that's when I complained about the bugs. All in all, the room was typical of super 8 nothing fancy. I liked the fridge in the room beds were nice. I made sure to take my sheets off every morning so they could be washed. The neighborhood is the hood. You are in the 9th ward. Not the lower 9th but you can still see some abandoned buildings. There isn't anything close by to eat except the taco truck that sets up in the abandoned motel next door. I didn't try it. We would sit on our patio nightly and see the same 2 hookers walk by, even saw a few police pursuits. The security guard was very helpful and gave us the in and outs of what streets to avoid. There isn't an ihop, wafflehouse or anything however do try Betsys pancake house it is about 15 minutes away. Overall I would not stay there again but possibly another super 8. This one is individually owned and it showed. Yuck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot think of a thing I don't like about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brettyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and spacious, we even had a fridge freezer! Location-wise it's not ideal BUT there is a number 94 bus which stops opposite the hotel which takes you downtown. The bus only costs $3 a day, for that you can get the 94 bus to Canal Street, then its about a 20 minute walk to the French Quarter or you can get on a Streetcar using the same ticket. If you're on a strict budget you can get a Jefferson Transit bus E-2 from the airport for $1.50, then connect on to the RTA Toulane bus 39 down to Canal Street, then connect to the 94 totaling your cost from the airport to the hotel at $3! When you get the 94 bus from the hotel you are best to get off at The Family Dollar at Canal Street, that is the closest stop to the French Quarter. You do pass another Fam,ily Dollar however, so don't get off too early, it's about a 20 minute journey. Look up the RTA online and get the 94 timetable if you want to plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sober up”
Reviews.Author: marinhonore
Reviews.Content: First time to New Orleans, decided to try all the historical drinks and shots. Obviously, after all that I was very intoxicated. We all checked in to this hotel, they had great prices compared to the other hotels and we slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Roaches”
Reviews.Author: youngish
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews. The front desk clerk was friendly. Our request for extra pillows was accommodated with no trouble. The property is older, the neighborhood is a bit rough, there is an abandoned hotel right next door, but overall it was acceptable and appeared neat though a little worn (holes in the bedspread). I woke during the middle of the night to use the bathroom. I turned on the light only to be greeted by scurrying roaches. I killed two of them, then went back to bed, unnerved, and couldn't sleep from that point on. When I informed my family that there were roaches in the bathroom, another one of my family members said that he killed a few too during the night. Upon checkout, I informed the front desk clerk that there were live roaches in the bathroom during the night. She simply said, "I'm sorry. The next time you stay here, if that happens, just call the front desk and we'll come up and take care of it." The next time? Seriously?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value! Surprisingly great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Don F
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the best price with the highest rating and this Super 8 turned out to be an outstanding value! The staff was very friendly, the security guard is a native and has great local info., the room was clean and odour free. I was in town for a week and stayed here every night. Some folks have expressed concern about the area, but it was fine - my 2012 rental car was parked along the street every night and there was no trouble at all. This was surely due to the excellent security on site! It's an industrial area, but quiet at night and easy to get to and from the important places in town. It's about 5 miles from the French Quarter. I would definitely stay again. The price was perfect, the room was clean and the staff was great. The only thing that I didn't like was that the wireless internet didn't seem to work in my room so well. I didn't use it, but the pool was large and clean and was very attractive. They were busy the entire week I was there, so all of those quests cannot be wrong!

Reviews.Title: “We truly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGirl6
Reviews.Content: I was there the past weekend for a mini vaction with my kids. The price was perfect for a single mom on a budget! And it was also close to many sites and restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful, and I will definitely be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good motel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Krzysiek82
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this place during my visit to New Orleans and it was nice enough. It's true that the architecture is a bit odd since the motels insides indeed look like a prison but other then aesthetic reason its not of a big deal. The motel is just minutes drive from the french quarter so its perfect for sightseeing. Theres not much to stay about the room; it was very clean and quite comfortable. No complaints about the staff either. All in all, good motel for those traveling on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cathy is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: corriespondent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Super 8 for a week and everything was great! But special mention goes to Cathy Smith, who went out of her way to track down the shoes that my 3 yr old son had left at the pool. Thanks to all the staff at Super 8 for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, on the cheap!”
Reviews.Author: PickyNurse71
Reviews.Content: Well, I was quite skeptical of staying in this area of town. It looks rough. I.Was.Wrong. Kenneth was off, but Nimesh was Awesome! He recommended a terrific Bistro for brunch. The room was spotless and smelled fresh. We were treated like we had spent 3 Times the amount of money for the room. They also had a terrific deal For cruise parking. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: caribbeancajun
Reviews.Content: OK, so it doesn't have the romance and mystique of the French Quarter or Garden District, but it doesn't have the prices, traffic, or noise either. In fact, it's quite a ways from all three. Located on Chef Menteur northeast of the Quarter, it's about 6 miles or so from all the "action" located in an ordinary neighborhood. Nothing flashy, no pool, easy to get to, well maintained, excellent friendly service, reasonably priced(half of what you'll pay in the Quarter or Garden district). It had it all for our needs(we would be gone most of the time anyways). The front desk staff were very helpful, friendly, and quickly got us into our room for an early check-in. Of special note was our room attendant Cathy who was exceptionally meticulous in keeping our room cleaned and was friendly beyond the call of duty. What a sweetheart! So if you aren't concerned about hype and flash and just want a well maintained, clean room at a good price, we can certainly recommend the Super 8 on Chef Menteur. We'll be back. Paul and Linda Lansing, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: shoegal56
Reviews.Content: We were well looked after here, by all the desk staff, housekeeping especially Miss Kathy! Everyone was so friendly and great! Rooms were clean, spacious, free internet and great access to public transport for a motel. Bus stop is across the road, takes you into canal street and just need to jump on streetcar and you will get to the french quarter. Breakfast variety was good and atmosphere fab. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great for agoraphobics”
Reviews.Author: vivvy54
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a long road trip, reviews here made it sound good. I expected the down-market location, but no-one mentioned the layout of the place, which I find very surprising. Ever watched a prison movie where the cells face each other over a dim, central stairwell? The only thing missing was a wire net stretched across the landing to catch you if you jumped off the railing. Room looked OK - well, what I could see of it. These rooms have no natural light at all, the only window overlooks the corridor. Couldn't stay there. The guy at the desk was nice, refunded my credit card without a problem and we moved on at once. Other reviewers mentioned that they like the old European design of this building - well as an old European I have to say that it gave me the creeps. Gloomy!

Reviews.Title: “desk service was great”
Reviews.Author: dancingsmith
Reviews.Content: when we first pulled up to the hotel we were worried but to be honest this hotel was a great experience. The personel in this hotel had experienced the Katrina hurricane and had experienced a terrible ordealbut they immediately made us feel welcome. offered us us a continental breakfast, maps of the area and also some interesting stories. When we went up to our room the rooms were clean and very nice. We meet the maid as we were entering our rooms and she was very helpful also. We were also offered free parking while we were on our cruise with ncl. Which was also a bonus. I have stayed at super 8 before this trip but this by far was my best stay. This hotel is located between French Quarter and Port of NOrleans Thank you so much. mary smith, san antonio, texas

Reviews.Title: “Good value Motel”
Reviews.Author: beijarflorx
Reviews.Content: Got in to N/O train station about 11pm, our train was delayed so we had to get a taxi to the Motel ( we had originally planned just to get the bus) Taxi driver was bit mental saying its miles away and that we were way out and why were we staying there - so that was a bit worrying but anyway it was 10mins away and cost $25.00 - so dont be put off by people saying its way out. There are buses that run regularly that take you to the French Quarter - if you are used to using public transport in different countries you will have no problem. Hotel is good, quiet and clean - didn't feel that it was in a bad area. Rooms were spacious - free breakfast and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “You will get a good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: hhermida68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a road trip with family. Right off of I-10. Prompt service. Clean rooms. Decent bathroom. Courteous staff. Fresh and plenty of the continental breakfast. Pool area very neat. For that price, What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great value esp during mardi gras time”
Reviews.Author: fatheadboby
Reviews.Content: Hi, I made reservation for couple nights during Mardi Gras in Jan ( kind of late for this ) but they had rooms for a good price compared to the qtr. Since I figured I would be hanging out in the qtr most the time it would not matter if it was 5 miles away. Other then the location which is a bit annoying because of the distance and the area was affected by Katrina it was a good deal, the service was great! ( thanks Tira! =) and the rooms were ample and clean which is what I look for most. I was riding public transportation so I took city buses to get there during the day and cab from the qtr which I paid $23 when i returned ( have to wheel and deal with the cabbies in NOLA ) they also provided a shuttle service that was only like $6 from the hotel to the QTR. All in all it would be great to stay in the qtr sometime with more planning though i would have no qualms with staying at this location again either.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel for exploring 'The Big Easy'”
Reviews.Author: cobbsy1988
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Super 8 after a mammoth 44 hour Greyhound journey from Washington DC. We had been working at a summer camp in upstate New York and were desperate to make our way to New Orleans having heard so many great things about the city. We arrived at the hotel around 6.30am. A taxi from the downtown train/bus station cost around $20, which split between 3 of us was good value! Although we arrived in the early morning, the staff behind the desk had no issues with us checking in so we could finally catch some comfortable sleep. The room itself was basic but clean and everything worked. After the bus journey we had, and 2 days on the road, it was more than acceptable! After sleeping for a few hours, around 2pm we had a shower and decided to make our way into downtown New Orleans. We had considered taking another taxi for our convenience, however there is a bus-stop just outside the hotel which provides a far cheaper albeit slightly lengthier option in terms of the journey time. The ticket costs around $3, which takes you to Canal Street. From there you can use it on the streetcar to go further down towards the Mississippi River and the legendary Bourbon Street and French Quarter. The price at the hotel includes a breakfast, which is basic (cereal, bread, pastries, some fruit) but filling. The staff behind the desk were more than helpful in recommending places to go and things to see and do. Despite the heavy rainfall during our stay, we thoroughly enjoyed the amazing atmosphere of New Orleans and I can't wait to return, and would definitely consider staying at this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsPinkLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting for his birthday and we liked this hotel. We stayed for three nights. For a Super 8, it was very nice. The staff was friendly, the value was great. The hotel is super clean and you are supplied with everything (iron, ironing board, blow dryer, etc). Free HBO. They also served a continental breakfast every morning. To my surprise, They actually wash the comforters on the bed! The only negative was the towels were a bit course. So bring your own towels if this will be a problem. However I do appreciate the commercial grade cleaning the linens get! The neighbor hood is not that great but we still felt safe. They locked one gate up at night, (double-entry) no visitors after 10 pm and the parking is F-R-E-E! Unheard of in NO. The grounds were also well cared for and the complex was very quiet and organized. I just adored the old new orleans style of the hotel,. It was only a 10 min or less drive to the French Quarter and it is very easy to find, right off the highway. We had no problems what so ever, check in/check out was hassle free. There is a corner store next door and there is a working ice maker on every floor! We'll be repeat visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: xoxomaxine
Reviews.Content: Location wasn't the best since there's a xxx video store down the street and a vacant hotel next to it. However, the staff was friendly, it was a great price considering it was only a 10 minute drive to the French Quarter and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: stltravelers64
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights here before our cruise in January thanks to all the positive reviews we read. The Motel did not disappoint us. From the first encounter with the night clerk who was so helpful helping us plan our next day to Tira at the front desk the next morning. She was just a joy to be around.The free parking was a pleasant surprise and we felt that it was a very safe place to leave our car for a week. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone who was staying in New Orleans. The drive to the Quarter was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: kimberstudio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to a cruise out of New Orleans. We stayed one night before the cruise and one night after. It was a decent hotel only about 15 minutes from the Quarter. We were able to park our car at there lot and take a taxi to the pier to get on the Cruise ship. The price of the taxi and the hotel was about the same as just parking on the pier. This is a no frills hotel, but it is clean and the bed was comfy. If you just need a place for a night or two I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not that nice!”
Reviews.Author: fbengr
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two days/nights and it was OK. The clerks at the front desk were friendly and helpful with directions and maps to the French Quarter. There aren't any resturants close by and you wouldn't want to go walking in the neighborhood. The beds are so so. The bathroom is small and the towels were stiff. The internet was easy to connect to. The TV was old but it worked OK. I probably would not stay there the next time I was in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cpicasner
Reviews.Content: Not a bad stay, more like a hotel than a motel. Interior rooms, indoor pool, oldstyle New Orleans architecture. Room was clean and neat but the bathroom was very small and the towels were coarse. the staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. The maid was very caring. In house computer wqs slow but worked fine. the breakfast was okay, just the usual choices. I would stay again. Parking seemed limited.

Reviews.Title: “Only for people who like to party all night”
Reviews.Author: Yilla
Reviews.Content: We hated it here. We did not feel safe at all. Drunk people in the room next to us, shouting all night. The motel staff did nothing about it. Shower faucet was so rusted we couldn't use it. Pets weren't allowed but we heard a dog bark all the time in one of the rooms. Maybe this is a good motel for young people who just want to party all night and don't care about the noise, but we will definitely not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: barbarainvegas
Reviews.Content: The staff excelled at being friendly and helpful! We especially enjoyed "Kenny's" good humor and cheeful attitude, Our room was kept spotless by "Miss Cathy" who made sure we had extra towels and a pleasant greeting everyday. By making direct reservations the hotel found us a reliable, trustworthy cab and driver who picked us up and dropped us off at the airport as well as getting us around town! Everything necessary for an affordable, pleasent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Easy on the budget”
Reviews.Author: gingerspice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group with a select baseball team and I was very leery of the area at the time of booking. I wasn't expecting much, actually, being a motel in a part of New Orleans that still bears the visible scars of Katrina 5 years later. The area doesn't have much going for it, but the hotel is a little gem. The rooms were extremely clean, our vehicles were safe (and the parking was great - and free - which is a major plus in New Orleans), and it was quiet. The rooms were cleaner than any motel I have ever stayed in before, although of typical size. The lobby was very well maintained, as were all of the facilities we checked out. I would definitely stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect-just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: SandyNSuzy
Reviews.Content: We were exhausted & just spending one night in town. Wanted something cheap, but clean. Looked up some cheap hotels on tripadvisor & found this one. The latest reviews were good, so we decided to go ahead & try it. It was around 3am when we got in, but had already called in a reservation & had a room. It was a little creepy coming in, & not in the prettiest location. But they had a pool, breakfast, clean rooms, & the basics - just what we needed. It was quiet, cheap(about $69), clean... we had no problems & it was only about 10 min. from downtown New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “great value and amazing front desk guy”
Reviews.Author: chomeuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal. We would definitely stay here again. Itâ€™s a 5-minute drive to the French Quarter, and the folks at the front desk will direct you to a $4 parking lot (a bargain) in the French Quarter when you go. In fact, the guy at the front desk when we arrived (I think he was the manager) was my favorite thing about this hotel. He was, hands down, the friendliest, most helpful, and most engaging hotel staff person Iâ€™ve ever encountered. First, he gave us a great price and accommodated our every need (silent room, super comfy bed). Then he made us laugh a lot. Then came the clincher: He gave us detailed instructions, on a map he provided, of exactly what we must do during our full day in New Orleans. And his instructions were marvelous. We had a super day in town, felt like we really left no stone unturned, and all on the cheap, thanks to him. Thing is, it wasnâ€™t that we were special. This guy treats everyone like that. Heâ€™s amazing. And all the front desk staff were very good. Not as special as him, but very good, miles above the what youâ€™d expect at a chain hotel. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The fixtures were a mix of old and new, but all were in good shape. Everything in the bathroom seemed brand new, like it had been recently remodeled. I think there was a fridge and microwave but I remember nothing about them. The hotel isn't in a great part of town, but it didn't matter as we were gone all day, and there's a parking security guard at night. It's very close to the I-10 onramp, convenient for what we were here to do: be tourists in New Orleans. Breakfast comes with the room. Itâ€™s the usual hotel grub. This place is so cheap and great, I canâ€™t think of a reason to stay in town. Including tax, our room was $66 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: travellingbambi
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because we were driving and it had free parking. It's 5 miles outside city but short taxi ride ($15-20). Sales manager Kenneth was so helpful with sightseeing & travel tips & maps. Room very comfortable and clean. Free breakfast - cereals, bagels/toast/pastries, juice, tea/coffee. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it sounds”
Reviews.Author: Paulofsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Jazzfest because it was the only place available. I think that is about the only situation in which I would stay here. It's really just too far from anything to make it worthwhile. Beyond that, the rooms were decent, but not above average for a 2-star motel. Decent beds & pillows, but worn-out linens. We had some road noise from the highway across the street, and the air conditioning only got the room down to about 75 degrees, despite turning it on as high as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, cheap, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Santafrique
Reviews.Content: A good place for the budget-minded traveler who wants a safe, clean, quiet place to sleep while visiting NOLA by car. There was a computer with wifi available for free, with a printer. If you want luxe, trendy, or charming, go somewhere else and you'll have to pay more. The staff was responsive and friendly, the room a nice size. Overall a bit shabby but clean and a great deal. The breakfast was minimal - coffee, juice, carbohydrates and boiled eggs (sometimes). The neighborhood is ugly but quiet and only minutes by car from downtown NOLA. We'd stay there again. Not a good place if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “highly adequate”
Reviews.Author: rootytoottoot
Reviews.Content: My doubles partner & i played a tennis tournament just below downtown, We saved beaucoups of $$ by staying at this motel just north of downtown. The area was a little rough, but the rooms were clean and quiet, and the staff were very helpful. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain”
Reviews.Author: TLD6255
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy - if you're looking to spend lots of time at a deluxe hotel rather than roaming the city, this isn't for you. But if, like us, you'd rather spend your money & time enjoying New Orleans and you're just looking for a clean, comfortable home base, this is a great value. It's about 6 miles from the French Quarter but once you're beyond walking distance, there's not much point paying extra to be closer, especially if you don't plan to spend every nite down there. The free breakfast was just cereal, pastries & toast, but we stayed out late listening to jazz every nite & slept thru it half the time anyway. The parking was cramped but felt safe w/the onsite guard. The neighborhood is commercial/industrial & nothing to look at but not scary at all. The rooms were smallish but the beds were comfy, and the front desk staff was mostly very helpful, giving good directions & great dining suggestions (including a dumpy little fish market up the street that they said also had great takeout, and they weren't wrong...the foam box full of catfish & fries was a delicious bargain.) We stayed 7 nights & figure we cut our lodging costs by HALF staying here instead of even the least inexpensive spots downtown...more money to spend on better things like rum drinks & crawfish ettouffee!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Seedlady50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a moderately priced motel during Mardi Gras and we found it here. It is a 10 minute drive to French Quarter but easy freeway access. Our room was a nice size, clean with fridge and microwave, adequate continental breakfast, friendly service and the Winn-Dixie down the road has tasty King Cake. It is disconcerting to see a vacant 10 story building next door. One of the many remnants of Katrina. We noted no "seedy' characters during our stay. While there are no restaurants within walking distance there are several fast-food places west on Chef Mentaur and neighborhood places to the east. The shower in the next room sometimes made a loud noise. My only complaint. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: caseyguillot
Reviews.Content: My companion and I booked easily booked a room at this motel online for December 26. We wanted to go to a pre-New Year's party in New Orleans that night but were on a tight budget. Upon arrival at the motel, we were greeted by a very helpful and courteous receptionist who carried a conversation and joked with us while checking us in and really made us feel at home. The motel itself is nothing illustrious, but it has adequate, free parking and all of the basic room amenities. The beds were comfortable enough, and the AC put out heat just fine. It is quite removed from the craziness of New Orleans, and we spent a quiet time while there. Continental breakfast is served in the morning, which is nothing spectacular, but as with the parking, it's FREE. We altogether enjoyed our stay and definitely would consider staying there again, especially if on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: JAMESD843
Reviews.Content: Owned and operated by family and employee(s) that live on site. Great service and as clean as pictures on website. Hotel was renovated after "Katrina". Price was already good by N.O. standards PLUS left car for free while on 7 day cruise. Hotel and round-trip shuttle service was no more than cost of parking at the port alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Bama1214
Reviews.Content: I originally booked two nights at this hotel. My wife and I decided to go a day early and we arrived at about 9 p.m. We checked in with no problems, and the gentleman that checked us in was wonderful. We came in with 2 minutes left in the Saints game, so we expected to be looked over due to everyone's attention on the game. To our surprise it was exactly the opposite. The gentleman asked it we would like some help taking our bags to our room. We told him that we were fine, but were pleasantly surprised by his attention. Once we were all settled, we wanted to take a drive around the city. On our way out, we were again greeted with a smile and great hospitality. He bagan printing off maps and telling us about all the great places to go. The cleaning staff was also very freindly and thorough. The continental breakfast was adequate for the price you pay for this hotel. Our only complaint was that the water never really got hot, only warm. It seemed like the more people that stayed the cooler it got! All in all we really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was the best I have probably ever experienced at any hotel. We would definatley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Seedy neighborhood but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho1363
Reviews.Content: My wife hated the hotel and vowed never to come back, primarily because of the neighborhood it was located in. There were some really shady characters staying here as well. As a guy, I didn't care because I was able to stay in New Orleans for a really good rate and could get down to the French Quarter in ~15 minutes. Based on my wife's reaction, this place isn't right for couples or families. I would say it's a guy's place only.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ahnicka
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4/30-5/2/09. I don't normally stay in motels...well, because they're motels...but since I wanted to experience New Orleans for the 1st time for a couple days before my cruise departed from there, and it just so happened to be Jazz Fest at the time, the hotels were 3-4 times the normal cost. I didn't want to pay the high cost being that I wasn't there for Jazz Fest, and wanted to be able to splurge while on my cruise, so given the positive reviews we stayed here. This is a great motel, I really felt as if I was having a hotel experience! We stayed in a room with 2 beds on the 3rd floor and it was plenty of space for us, and it didn't have an old look or feel to it. It basically looks just like it does online. Personally I think the rooms are equivalent or bigger than a standard room at the Hyatt for a mere fraction of the cost. The customer service was exemplary; whenever we needed a cab to take to the French Quarter (about a 10- 15 min. taxi ride, approx cost $15/$16), we merely told the front desk and they called one for us each and every time with no problem. We'd go to the front desk and it request it there and wait because the taxis show up very promptly. They have a business center where you can use their computer and internet for free and use their printer for free. I needed to fax something and that was also free, you just present them with the documents and they fax it behind the counter and give your documents right back to you. You can also request them to print out the fax confirmation, also free of cost. They have free hearty continental breakfast, a free exercise room, snack and drink vending (at cost) and ice machines, and local calls are free from your room. I don't think the neighborhood is bad, it's just not a residential or business type of neighborhood; not sure how to describe it; somewhat industrial maybe, and the building that was a hotel right next door to the Super 8 was never renovated or knocked down after Hurricane Katrina so that may give it a bit of a rough appearance, but not much; it's very tolerable. A taxi driver told me the destroyed building used to be a Holiday Inn and it was just never fixed or bull dozed. There aren't any restaurants within walking distance from what I can tell, and no room service, but the motel has menus they provide you with of food places that deliver. One was an extremely economical chinese food place which delivers take-out and they gave me so much food, at least 2 or 3 people can feed off an order for one. I think the other place may have been a pizza delivery restaurant, but I didn't try it. I was really impressed by the level of service I received given that it's a motel. It turned out to be a very enjoyable experience. There is one thing that is odd, but not at all bad. The motel is raised above ground as you can see from their online pics, and every once in a while it feels like it rocks. I'm not sure if it's from a strong wind or what, but it's a unique thing to experience, but not at all frightening. Enjoy your stay, I certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: FunOkie
Reviews.Content: Clean Room, Friendly Staff, Covered Parking, Great Price. The room size is standard for a discount type of motel. The continetal breakfast was good. It is just 10 - 15 minute drive to the FQ. The AC unit was a new digital type of unit that was not quiet but not loud. The bathroom was small but functional. I will stay here again if I have a chance to come back to The Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Super 8!”
Reviews.Author: golddust62
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... we just needed to stay somewhere relatively near the French Quarter for one night... decided to stay here even though some of the reviews weren't that good. When we arrived, the check in was easy, and when we arrived in our room, it was large, clean and comfortable! Great staff and wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Close to University of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: RMeChic
Reviews.Content: In June 2008, my son and I stayed at the Super 8 Motel after his freshman orientation at the University of New Orleans. This hotel is conveniently located off I-10 at exit 240B and is close to UNO and the French Quarter. I researched several hotels in the area and this was one of the least expensive. I was happy to discover that I had enough Triprewards points to use for a free room at Super 8. This hotel was clean and comfortable. It had flooded during Hurricane Katrina so it had been recently remodeled. The staff was familiar with UNO and gave my son tips on where to go when he moves down there in August. They also gave us advice of where the best parking was in the French Quarter. We spent most of our time sightseeing in the French Quarter so we didn't take advantage of the swimming pool.
