The next morning my son slept in and I enjoyed my free breakfast.. I'll be staying here in the future when visiting my son or visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Cheapskate's paradise”
Reviews.Author: palmermany
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It was a real bargain without sacrificing cleanliness, location, or safety. My room consisted of 2 comfortable queen size beds, a table with 2 comfortable chairs, a 25 inch TV sitting on the side of a dresser, and a small fridge. I really enjoyed the small fridge. It makes it easy to store restaurant leftovers, sodas, bottled water, etc. This hotel does not have room service so make use of the small refrigerator. The drive to Canal Street was only 10-15 min. The only worry was where to park once you got there. My friend and I found parking convenient at Harrah's casino. If you gamble for 30 min. or more you get your parking validated, so therefore it is free. Hey, play a penny slot machine for 30 min. or something. Otherwise pay the $15-$30 per day parking in the lots downtown. The room had a full size ironing board and iron. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They gave us advice on where to go to get great seafood and various other helpful tips that only the locals would know. The gates are locked nightly so you don't have to worry about your vehicle. Overall, a great hotel for those traveling on a budget. Oh and before I forget - Continental breakfast is served every morning. This consists of bagels, muffins, cereal, cream cheese, jelly, milk, and OJ. there are toasters and microwaves to warm your pastries as well as a large dining room with 10-15 tables to use. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Stayce
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights (May 1st - May 4th) at The Super 8 in New Orleans for Jazz Fest. The hotel room was very clean and provided ample space. The hotel was actually cleaner than a lot of the 3 star hotels that I have stayed in. The front desk staff were friendly and answerwed our many questions. The breakfast provided consisted of cereal, bagels, pastries, muffins, coffee, tea, milk and orange juice. The hotel is convienently located right near I-10 which was only a 10 minute drive to the French Quarter. I would recommend this hotel to friends and stay here on my next vist to N'wlins.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Beachamorgan
Reviews.Content: We attended Jazz Fest and wanted a hotel near to a bus line so we would not have to pay for parking. I was a bit concerned when we checked in because of the hotel across the street. The staff said it had recently had the power cut so the squatters would move out. The neighborhood is not so good, it's just kind of desolate, but we never worried about leaving our car because there is a security guard on the property. The hotel is kind of cute, its raised and all the rooms are on the second and third levels. Parking is underneath. They have a courtyard of sorts on the ground level with water fountains and raised plantings. I really enjoyed having a cup of coffee outside every morning. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good enough, about average for a deluxe continental. I would recommend this hotel for Jazz Fest to anyone due to the location. Its a bit far from the tourist area but if you are pinching pennies you can take the bus, it stops very near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came with some friends during New Year's Eve, and stayed at the Super 8. We really enjoyed our time in New Orleans. The rooms were nice and comfortable and very reasonably priced. The front desk agents helped us with transportation services to and from the French Quarter. We loved the staff as a whole, especially the breakfast lady, who was a hoot to talk to. Will be coming back very soon for Jazz Fest.

Reviews.Title: “Bad part of city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's a maze alright, aMazing you get out of this area in one piece!!!! This area is a high crime area of New Orleans East. If you are to visit New Orleans, Stay to the uptown area, Slidell or Metarie. DO NOT STAY ON CHEF HWY.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 - New Orleans
HotelInfo.Address: 6322 Chef Menteur Highway, New Orleans, LA 70126
